nodes.Description:
CAPEC-586: Object Injection
An adversary attempts to exploit an application by injecting additional,
malicious content during its processing of serialized objects. Developers
leverage serialization in order to convert data or state into a static, binary
format for saving to disk or transferring over a network. These objects are then
deserialized when needed to recover the data/state. By injecting a malformed
object into a vulnerable application, an adversary can potentially compromise
the application by manipulating the deserialization process. This can result in
a number of unwanted outcomes, including remote code execution.
nodes.label: Object Injection
